data.title: Robert Menzies (pictured with NZ PM Walter Nash)
data.meta_description: On 20 December 1894 Robert Menzies was born. He was the 12th Prime Minister of Australia and served a collective 18 years as Prime Minister across numerous terms. He is to date Australia's longest serving Prime Minister. Menzies was Prime Minister during WW2 from 1939 to 1941. He was later Prime Minister from 1949 through to 1966. Menzies resigned on Australia Day 1966, after spending 32 years in Parliament. On his retirement he became the thirteenth Chancellor of the University of Melbourne and remained the head of the university from March 1967 until March 1972. Menzies died from a heart attack in Melbourne in 1978 and was accorded a state funeral, held in Scots' Church, Melbourne, at which Prince Charles represented Queen Elizabeth. The images presented here are from the Sir Walter Nash papers held at Archives New Zealand. Walter Nash was the Prime Minister of New Zealand from December 1957 to December 1960. Other images from the Nash papers have been digitised and are available to view in an online exhibition archives.govt.nz/events/walters-world-nash-collection Archives New Zealand references: AEFZ 22625 W5727 684 2163/0155 - ANZAC DAY 1960 AEFZ 22625 W5727 2596 3102/0008-0009 - R.G. Menzies, Prime Minister of Australia, visits Auckland 1941 For updates on our On This Day series and news from Archives New Zealand, follow us on Twitter twitter.com/ArchivesNZ Material supplied by Archives New Zealand Te Rua Mahara o te Kāwanatanga
data.text:
On 20 December 1894 Robert Menzies was born. He was the 12th Prime Minister of Australia and served a collective 18 years as Prime Minister across numerous terms. He is to date Australia's longest serving Prime Minister.

Menzies was Prime Minister during WW2 from 1939 to 1941. He was later Prime Minister from 1949 through to 1966. Menzies resigned on Australia Day 1966, after spending 32 years in Parliament. On his retirement he became the thirteenth Chancellor of the University of Melbourne and remained the head of the university from March 1967 until March 1972.

Menzies died from a heart attack in Melbourne in 1978 and was accorded a state funeral, held in Scots' Church, Melbourne, at which Prince Charles represented Queen Elizabeth.

The images presented here are from the Sir Walter Nash papers held at Archives New Zealand. Walter Nash was the Prime Minister of New Zealand from December 1957 to December 1960. Other images from the Nash papers have been digitised and are available to view in an online exhibition archives.govt.nz/events/walters-world-nash-collection

Archives New Zealand references:

AEFZ 22625 W5727 684 2163/0155 - ANZAC DAY 1960

AEFZ 22625 W5727 2596 3102/0008-0009 - R.G. Menzies, Prime Minister of Australia, visits Auckland 1941

For updates on our On This Day series and news from Archives New Zealand, follow us on Twitter twitter.com/ArchivesNZ

Material supplied by Archives New Zealand Te Rua Mahara o te Kāwanatanga
